questions.explanation: Ulf Merbold from Germany was the first ESA astronaut to fly in space, on STS-9 in 1983.

questions.question: Which astronaut spent the most cumulative time in space among all astronauts worldwide?
questions.explanation: Gennady Padalka holds the record for the most cumulative time in space, with over 878 days across multiple missions.

questions.question: Which astronaut commanded the first U.S. space station, Skylab?
questions.explanation: Pete Conrad commanded Skylab's first crew in 1973, leading efforts to repair damage sustained during launch.

questions.question: Which Apollo mission conducted the first lunar landing?
questions.explanation: Apollo 11 completed the first Moon landing in 1969, with Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin on the surface.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to tweet from space?
questions.explanation: Mike Massimino sent the first tweet from space in 2009, aboard the Space Shuttle Atlantis.

questions.question: Who was the second person to walk on the Moon?
questions.explanation: Buzz Aldrin was the second person to set foot on the Moon, following Neil Armstrong during Apollo 11.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to fly in both the Gemini and Apollo programs?
questions.explanation: Gus Grissom flew in both the Gemini and Apollo programs, the only astronaut to do so before his death in 1967.

questions.question: Which spacecraft was the first to carry humans into space?
questions.explanation: Vostok 1 carried Yuri Gagarin into space in 1961, marking humanity's first crewed spaceflight.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to stay aboard the ISS for an entire mission in command?
questions.explanation: Peggy Whitson became the first female commander of the ISS and held the role for an entire mission.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to test the lunar rover on the Moon?
questions.explanation: John Young tested the lunar rover on the Moon during the Apollo 16 mission in 1972.

questions.question: Who was the first Chinese astronaut to reach space?
questions.explanation: Yang Liwei was China's first astronaut in space, flying aboard Shenzhou 5 in 2003.

questions.question: Which astronaut holds the record for most days spent in space by a female astronaut?
questions.explanation: Peggy Whitson set a record for the most days in space by a woman, with a cumulative total of 665 days.

questions.question: What was the purpose of the Apollo-Soyuz mission?
options: Docking between U.S. and Soviet spacecraft
questions.answer: Docking between U.S. and Soviet spacecraft
questions.explanation: The Apollo-Soyuz mission was the first international crewed space mission, docking U.S. and Soviet spacecraft in 1975.

questions.question: Which astronaut orbited Earth in the first U.S. spaceflight?
questions.explanation: John Glenn was the first American to orbit Earth on February 20, 1962, during Friendship 7.

questions.question: Who was the last astronaut to walk on the Moon?
questions.explanation: Eugene Cernan was the last person to walk on the Moon during the Apollo 17 mission in 1972.

questions.question: Which country launched the first space station?
questions.explanation: The Soviet Union launched the first space station, Salyut 1, in 1971.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to die during a space mission?
questions.explanation: Vladimir Komarov was the first astronaut to die in space, during the Soyuz 1 mission in 1967.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to bring back moon rocks?
questions.explanation: Neil Armstrong collected the first moon rocks as souvenirs from the Apollo 11 mission in 1969.

questions.question: Which astronaut became the first woman to command a Space Shuttle mission?
questions.explanation: Eileen Collins became the first female commander of a Space Shuttle mission with STS-93 in 1999.

questions.question: Which astronaut was the first American to complete an orbit of Earth?
questions.explanation: John Glenn was the first American to orbit Earth on February 20, 1962, aboard Friendship 7.

questions.question: Who was the first woman to travel to space as an astronaut?
questions.explanation: Valentina Tereshkova was the first woman in space, flying aboard Vostok 6 in 1963.

questions.question: Which astronaut famously said, 'That's one small step for man, one giant leap for mankind'?
questions.explanation: Neil Armstrong said this historic phrase as he stepped onto the lunar surface during Apollo 11.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to fly into space twice?
questions.explanation: Gus Grissom was the first astronaut to fly twice, once with Mercury-Redstone 4 and again with Gemini 3.

questions.question: What was the primary goal of the Gemini program?
questions.explanation: Gemini missions were designed to prepare for Apollo by testing docking, spacewalking, and duration capabilities.

questions.question: Who was the first African American astronaut in space?
questions.explanation: Guion Bluford became the first African American in space, flying on STS-8 in 1983.

questions.question: Who was the first person to complete a spacewalk?
questions.explanation: Alexei Leonov performed the first spacewalk in 1965 on the Voskhod 2 mission.

questions.question: Which astronaut holds the record for the longest single spaceflight by a female astronaut?
questions.explanation: Christina Koch spent 328 days in space on a single mission, the longest for a female astronaut.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to fly in space after a serious medical issue?
questions.explanation: Alan Shepard returned to flight on Apollo 14 after recovering from an inner ear disorder.

questions.question: Who was the first Japanese astronaut to fly in space?
questions.explanation: Toyohiro Akiyama was the first Japanese astronaut in space, launched aboard Soyuz TM-11 in 1990.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to go to space from outside the USA or USSR?
questions.explanation: Cuban astronaut Arnaldo Tamayo M√©ndez became the first non-U.S./USSR astronaut in space in 1980.

questions.question: Who was the first American female astronaut to fly in space?
questions.explanation: Sally Ride became the first American woman in space on the STS-7 mission in 1983.

questions.question: Which astronaut set the record for longest cumulative time in space by an American astronaut?
questions.explanation: Peggy Whitson holds the record for the longest cumulative time in space for an American, with 665 days.

questions.question: Which mission brought back the first lunar soil samples?
questions.explanation: Apollo 11 collected the first samples from the lunar surface in 1969.

questions.question: Who was the first Muslim astronaut to fly in space?
questions.explanation: Prince Sultan bin Salman of Saudi Arabia was the first Muslim astronaut, flying on STS-51-G in 1985.

questions.question: Which astronaut performed the longest U.S. spacewalk on record?
questions.explanation: Sunita Williams completed the longest U.S. spacewalk, lasting over 8 hours.

questions.question: Who was the first private astronaut to reach the ISS?
questions.explanation: Dennis Tito became the first private astronaut to reach the ISS in 2001.

questions.question: Which mission faced an in-flight emergency due to a faulty oxygen tank?
questions.explanation: Apollo 13 encountered an oxygen tank explosion, requiring the crew to return to Earth without landing on the Moon.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to conduct a spacewalk without being connected to the spacecraft?
questions.explanation: Bruce McCandless conducted the first untethered spacewalk in 1984 using the Manned Maneuvering Unit.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to record music in space?
questions.explanation: Chris Hadfield recorded a cover of David Bowie's 'Space Oddity' aboard the ISS in 2013.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut from India to reach space?
questions.explanation: Rakesh Sharma was the first Indian astronaut in space, flying aboard Soyuz T-11 in 1984.

questions.question: Who was the first female astronaut from NASA to serve as commander of the ISS?
questions.explanation: Peggy Whitson served as the first female commander of the ISS in 2008.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to experience space tourism on a private spacecraft?
questions.explanation: Dennis Tito was the first private space tourist, flying aboard Soyuz TM-32 to the ISS in 2001.

questions.question: Which astronaut holds the record for the longest single space mission by an American?
questions.explanation: Scott Kelly set the record for the longest single mission by an American with 340 days on the ISS.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to command both a Space Shuttle and the ISS?
questions.explanation: Sunita Williams commanded both the Space Shuttle and the ISS, showing her leadership versatility.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to live continuously on a space station for over a year?
questions.explanation: Valeri Polyakov spent 437 consecutive days on the Mir space station, setting a record for long-term stay.

questions.question: Which astronaut was the first to vote in a U.S. election from space?
questions.explanation: Kate Rubins cast the first vote from space in 2016 while aboard the ISS.

questions.question: Who was the first Asian astronaut in space?
questions.explanation: Rakesh Sharma was the first Asian astronaut in space, launching aboard Soyuz T-11 in 1984.

questions.question: Which astronaut has the most cumulative spacewalking time?
questions.explanation: Anatoly Solovyev holds the record for the most cumulative time spent on spacewalks.

questions.question: Who was the first European astronaut to fly aboard a NASA Space Shuttle?
questions.explanation: Ulf Merbold was the first ESA astronaut to fly aboard a NASA Space Shuttle in 1983 on STS-9.

questions.question: Which astronaut was the first to command a joint U.S.-Soviet space mission?
questions.explanation: Tom Stafford commanded the Apollo half of the Apollo-Soyuz Test Project, a historic joint mission in 1975.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to reach space on a suborbital flight?
questions.explanation: Alan Shepard became the first American in space in 1961, making a suborbital flight on Freedom 7.

questions.question: Which astronaut spent the longest cumulative time aboard the ISS?
questions.explanation: Peggy Whitson spent over 665 days aboard the ISS across her missions, setting a record for Americans.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to record a video blog (vlog) from space?
questions.explanation: Chris Hadfield became popular for sharing his space experiences through vlogs and social media.

questions.question: Who was the first civilian astronaut to fly aboard the Space Shuttle?
questions.explanation: Christa McAuliffe was selected as the first civilian, a teacher, to fly on the Challenger mission in 1986.

questions.question: Which astronaut served as a backup crew member for multiple Apollo missions?
questions.explanation: Ken Mattingly served as a backup for several missions, including Apollo 13, from which he was reassigned last minute.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut from South Korea to go to space?
questions.explanation: Yi So-yeon became South Korea's first astronaut in 2008 aboard a Soyuz spacecraft.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to complete three spaceflights with three different space vehicles?
questions.explanation: Wally Schirra flew aboard Mercury, Gemini, and Apollo, making him the only astronaut to do so.

questions.question: Which astronaut was the first to celebrate Christmas in space?
questions.explanation: Frank Borman, Jim Lovell, and William Anders celebrated Christmas aboard Apollo 8 as they orbited the Moon.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to pilot a spacecraft through a full orbit of the Moon?
questions.explanation: Michael Collins orbited the Moon solo in the command module while Armstrong and Aldrin walked on the lunar surface.

questions.question: Which astronaut has spent the most time in space among all astronauts?
questions.explanation: Gennady Padalka holds the world record for the most cumulative days in space, with 878 days over five missions.

questions.question: Which astronaut was the first to broadcast a live stream from the Moon?
questions.explanation: Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin broadcasted the first live video stream from the Moon during Apollo 11.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to pilot a Space Shuttle and later command the ISS?
questions.explanation: Peggy Whitson was the first woman to command both a Space Shuttle mission and the ISS.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to be promoted to the rank of general while in space?
questions.explanation: Thomas Stafford was promoted to brigadier general during his Apollo 10 mission.

questions.question: Which astronaut was part of the first all-female spacewalk?
questions.explanation: Christina Koch and Jessica Meir performed the first all-female spacewalk in October 2019.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to perform a spacewalk with a self-contained maneuvering unit?
questions.explanation: Bruce McCandless used the Manned Maneuvering Unit during the first untethered spacewalk in 1984.

questions.question: Which astronaut made a historic emergency landing in the Siberian forest?
questions.explanation: Alexei Leonov and his crewmate crash-landed in the Siberian wilderness after a space mission due to a malfunction.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to represent Canada in space?
questions.explanation: Marc Garneau was the first Canadian astronaut in space, flying on a Space Shuttle mission in 1984.

questions.question: Who was the first astronaut to live aboard a space station for an entire year?
questions.explanation: Valeri Polyakov spent over a year on the Mir space station, setting a record for the longest continuous spaceflight.

questions.question: Which astronaut inspired the Space Foundation's annual 'Teacher in Space' award?
questions.explanation: The 'Teacher in Space' award was established to honor Christa McAuliffe's legacy after her Challenger mission.
